Summary Product manager with business and engineering background, with experience in developing and launching successful products at T-Mobile, Microsoft, and Intel. Product development experience portfolio includes T-Mobile Visual Voicemail, Microsoft Windows Phone, and Microsoft HoloLens. 
 
Additional technical and business experience at NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratory, Tatung Company, and various start-ups.  
 
Excellent communication and organization skills, with experience leading cross-functional product and development teams.  
 
Here are some of my recent Product Management and Product Development Projects:  
 
•	Inbound Marketing – Authored 25 Project Management articles; managed 2 social media profiles  
•	Facebook Seattle Android CodeRush – Designed and built an Android Cyanogen student profile to disable device notifications when entering school Wi-Fi, and re-enable when leaving campus. 
•	SEARS Hackathon – Built a winning game using AngularJS, Apigee BaaS, that allows the user to login via Facebook, create an adventure story, learn about Sears products, and share to social media.  
•	AT&T ARO Hackathon – Conducted Mobile testing, and won best mobile app test results 
•	City of Seattle Hack the Commute – Finalist for utilizing public data, and Walkscore to design service to locate the optimal neighborhood to minimize commute time by bike, car, & bus in Seattle.  
•	AT&T Women & Tech Hackathon – 3 first place prizes for using Seattle public data, and ESRI maps to design a safety mobile app to share crowd-sourced and historical crime incidents. 
•	CaseBooker.com – Surveyed customers, defined product requirements, and over 9 months, led a 2-person team to build from scratch a student marketplace for law textbooks. Managed UX, product features, gathered customer feedback, and placed into the UW and Seattle U B-plan competitions.  
 
Let us meet to see how I can help you and your company. Founder MatterCompilers September 2013  – Present (2 years) Portland, Oregon Area MatterCompilers sells desktop 3D printers and related accessories, training, and service. We also offer consulting services to help you choose and integrate 3D printing into your business. We are passionate about building a 3D printing community in Portland. Join us at our meetup: 
 
http://www.meetup.com/Portland-3D-Printing-Lab/ 
 
Contact me if you're looking for consultation, speaking engagements, and other contracting work related to 3D printing. Founder DongleKong January 2013  – Present (2 years 8 months) Portland, OR DongleKong kits give you everything you need to connect your MacBook or UItraBook to a conference room projector or HDTV. Simply tell us which laptop you have and we'll build a kit with video/audio adapters, a presentation remote, and our famous 1-year guarantee. Consultant, Advisor, Volunteer Startup Weekend January 2011  –  June 2015  (4 years 6 months) Portland, OR Startup Weekend is a global network of passionate leaders and entrepreneurs on a mission to inspire, educate, and empower individuals, teams and communities. As volunteer Lead Organizer, I focused Portland Startup Weekend's mission, grew attendance, and built an organizing team that greatly refined the event. I implemented the first City Hub that unites Oregon Startup Weekend teams to document+share best practices, plan a single event calendar, train organizers, simplify multiple-event sponsorships, and deliver innovative new events including Axxess (Blind and Deaf), Culinary Innovation, and Youth (serving High School students). Members events include Eugene, Portland State, Oregon State, Willamette, Mercy Corps Tech 4 Change, and Bend.

Program Manager TiE 2011  –  December 2012  (1 year) Portland, Oregon Area Facilitor for TiE Oregon Pitchfest events Product Manager Intel Corporation November 1998  –  December 2012  (14 years 2 months) Hillsboro, OR I uncover new, simpler ways to use Intel Wireless Display (WiDi) and turn them into compelling products. In this role I devised the Intel WiDi Extensions SDK, which allows app developers to find wireless-enabled TV screens and extend their content to them. Using this SDK, we've added "Play to WiDi" buttons to several major media applications and created the "WiDi Widget" (100k+ downloads!) - friction-free ways to move your content from your PC to TV without worrying about compatibility. 
 
I also work with ISVs interested in making their products sparkle with Intel WiDi. Download the Intel WiDi Extensions (http://tinurl.com/widisdk) and contact me if you're developing something amazing! Summary Anil Agrawal has over 20 years of working experience, with over 12 years in Semiconductor industry. He has been with Intel since Jan 2000 and is currently working as Technical Lead for RAS (Reliability Availability Serviceability) within the “Datacenter Engineering Group”. As an “account owner”, he has been responsible for supporting a leading server OEM in designing their server products. Prior to this role, Anil worked as Platform Enabling Manager and was responsible for enabling ecosystem products complementing Intel Architecture Platform in the area of purpose-built Security, Networking, and Storage Appliances. Anil also led the enabling work for Intel's AdvancedTCA® communication server blades and supporting key customer design wins. Prior to the Platform Enabling role, Anil worked as, Platform Solutions Architect, Product Application Manager, Technical Marketing Engineer at various divisions within Intel.  
 
Anil has also managed TME team supporting Intel’s Ethernet Switching products and led several key customer design-wins. 
 
Prior to joining Intel, he worked at Level One Communications as Staff Technical Marketing Engineer and led several key designs to production in HDSL/HDSL2 modem space. 
 
Specialties: Technical Marketing Management, Product Application Engineering, Solutions Architect, and Product Marketing.
